  "description": "The King Collective Merchants is a leading supplier and distributor of a diverse range of products to meet the everyday needs of our customers. From premium alcoholic and non-alcoholic beverages to the latest electronics and essential household items, we pride ourselves on offering high-quality products that enhance the lives of our clients.

With a commitment to excellence and reliability, we carefully select each item in our catalog, ensuring that we deliver only the best to our customers. Whether you&#39;re stocking up your home bar, upgrading your gadgets, or shopping for home essentials, we are your trusted partner in bringing convenience and satisfaction directly to your doorstep.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Sales /&nbsp;Key Account&nbsp;Executive
Job Location:&nbsp;Port Harcourt, Rivers
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description


	A Key Account Executive plays a vital role in driving business growth by strengthening client relationships and ensuring that the company delivers tailored solutions that meet client needs.
	The ideal candidate will have strong sales skills, a proactive attitude, and the ability to manage complex relationships and projects effectively.


Key Responsibilities


	Client Relationship Management: Develop and maintain strong, long-term relationships with key accounts, understanding their business objectives, challenges, and needs to provide personalized solutions.
	Sales Strategy &amp; Account Planning: Develop and execute account plans that align with company sales goals. Identify opportunities to increase revenue and expand the company&rsquo;s market share within key accounts.
	Client Communication &amp; Reporting: Serve as the main point of contact for key accounts, ensuring that communication is timely and effective. Regularly provide clients with status updates and reports on account performance.
	Business Development: Identify new business opportunities within assigned accounts and work with the sales team to secure new deals and partnerships.
	Contract Management: Negotiate contracts, pricing, and terms with key clients while ensuring mutually beneficial agreements.
	Problem-Solving &amp; Issue Resolution: Address any client issues or concerns promptly, collaborating with internal teams to resolve problems effectively.
	Cross-Functional Collaboration: Work closely with other departments such as marketing, product development, and customer service to deliver a seamless experience for key accounts.
	Sales Targets &amp; Performance Tracking: Meet or exceed assigned sales targets by strategically expanding the company&#39;s footprint within key accounts.
	Market Analysis: Conduct market research and competitive analysis to understand client needs and market trends, ensuring your offering remains competitive.


Requirements
Education:


	OND / HND qualification&nbsp;in Business Administration, Marketing, Sales, or a related field.


Experience:


	1 - 2 years&nbsp;of experience in key account management, sales, or business development roles.
	Proven track record of managing and growing key accounts, achieving sales targets, and delivering client satisfaction.
	Experience in B2B (Business-to-Business)or B2C (Business-to-Consumer)&nbsp;sales is typically required, depending on the industry.
	Experience in using CRM (Customer Relationship Management) tools such as Salesforce, HubSpot, or similar platforms.


Key Skills:


	Account Management: Strong experience in managing key accounts and ensuring client satisfaction.
	Sales &amp; Negotiation: Expertise in developing sales strategies, negotiating deals, and closing sales.
	Relationship Building: Ability to cultivate and maintain long-term business relationships with clients.
	Problem Solving: Excellent at identifying challenges and developing creative solutions.
	Communication: Exceptional verbal and written communication skills to effectively interact with clients and internal teams.
	Strategic Thinking: Ability to think strategically to identify new opportunities and drive business growth.
	Time Management: Ability to manage multiple accounts and prioritize tasks effectively.
	Customer Focus: Strong customer-centric mindset with a focus on exceeding client expectations.


Other Requirements:


	Self-Motivated: Must be able to work independently and take initiative in managing accounts.
	Tech-Savvy: Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint), CRM systems, and other relevant sales tools.
	Industry Knowledge: Familiarity with the industry, allowing for better insights into customer needs and business trends.
	Route To Market: Understanding of Modern Trade and Open Market.


Remuneration


	Salary-based (N100,000 - M150,000 / Month).
	Incentives tied to meeting or exceeding sales targets and key performance indicators (KPIs).
	Benefits: Annual Leave
	Travel/Expense Reimbursement: Coverage for business-related logistics and expenses.


Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;hr@ourdrinksnmore.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",

Partnership Manager Job at OPay




        
    

        
        OPay is a mobile money platform operated by OPay Digital Services Limited and licensed by the Central Bank of Nigeria. Launched in June 2018, the company has spread its services across all 36 states in Nigeria with over 500,000 mobile money merchants. We are more than a payment company. We believe everyone should be able to enjoy financial and social inclusion, without regard for physical borders, boundaries, or even social status.

OPay is a one-stop mobile-based platform for payment and other important services in your everyday life. Millions of users rely on OPay every day to send and receive money and pay bills.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Partnership Manager

Job Location: Lagos
Mode: Onsite
Department: Partnerships
Reports To: Head of Partnerships

Job Summary


	The Partnership Manager will be responsible for identifying, developing, and managing strategic partnerships that support business growth and enhance the company’s market presence.
	The ideal candidate is a strong relationship-builder with excellent negotiation skills, business acumen, and experience working in fast-paced environments.


Key Responsibilities
Partnership Strategy & Development:


	Identify new partnership opportunities aligned with company objectives.
	Conduct market research to evaluate potential partners, industries, and trends.
	Develop partnership proposals and drive end-to-end negotiation processes.


Relationship Management:


	Build and manage long-term relationships with key partners, stakeholders, and external organizations.
	Serve as the main point of contact for partnership-related communication.
	Ensure partner satisfaction and address challenges proactively.


Execution & Performance Management:


	Collaborate with internal teams (Product, Marketing, Operations, Compliance, Legal, etc.) to operationalize partnership initiatives.
	Track partnership performance, ensure deliverables are met, and optimize initiatives to increase value.
	Monitor and report on KPIs, revenue impact, and overall partnership effectiveness.


Contract & Compliance Oversight:


	Work closely with Legal and Compliance teams to review contracts and ensure all partnership activities meet regulatory requirements.
	Manage contract renewals and ensure adherence to agreed terms.


Cross-Functional Collaboration:


	Support co-marketing campaigns, joint events, and activation activities with partners.
	Work with Finance to review partnership-related budgets, incentives, and payouts.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s Degree in Business Administration, Marketing, Economics, or a related field.
	3 - 6 years of experience in partnerships, business development, or key account management—preferably in fintech, banking, or technology.
	Proven track record of negotiating and managing successful partnerships.
	Strong analytical, organizational, and project management skills.
	Excellent communication, presentation, and stakeholder engagement abilities.
	Ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment and manage multiple projects.
	High level of professionalism, integrity, and problem-solving ability.


Why Join OPay?


	At OPay, you’ll play a vital role in shaping a compliant and trusted financial ecosystem for millions of users across Africa.
	Join a fast-paced team where innovation meets integrity.

  "description": "Jhpiego, an Affiliate of Johns Hopkins University, is a global leader in improving healthcare services for women and their families.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;Health Informatics Officer&nbsp;

Job ID:&nbsp;2025-7325
Job Locations:&nbsp;Abuja
Category:&nbsp;International Positions

Overview


	Jhpiego, an affiliate of Johns Hopkins University, is implementing digital health solutions to support public health programs.
	As part of ongoing system improvements and program expansion, Jhpiego seeks a to hire a competent individual to implement a series of technical developments, enhancements, refinements, and compliance updates for its mobile health applications.


Responsibilities


	Implement mobile app changes collated from visits from project supported states.
	Update and integrate Predictive Analysis into new and existing mobile applications.
	Improve the Mobile applications based on feedback loop during data synchronization operations.
	Implement historical risk score view on all developed mobile applications.
	Enhance the monthly in-app pulse surveys and feedback mechanisms to ensure adequate use of developed mobile applications.
	Implement modular architecture for existing mobile solutions to enable future expansion to other disease areas.
	Design and develop accessibility features in existing and future mobile applications.
	Implement in-app push notifications across mobile applications developed.
	Integrate existing mobile application with external APIs like the NAFDAC Greenbook, LOMIS.
	Implement and monitor the Optical Character Recognition (OCR) feature in developed mobile applications.
	Upgrade and develop robust user manuals for the existing and future mobile applications.
	Integrate existing and future mobile solutions into robust backends for unified data storage.
	Design and implement database storage mechanisms for robust data collection across all mobile solutions.


Deliverables:


	Implemented changes and bug fixes identified in all deployed mobile applications.
	Modularized codebase supporting plug-and-play modules for new disease areas (e.g., TB, MNCH) with architecture documentations.
	Functional accessibility settings (e.g., font scaling, screen reader support, colour contrast), user documentation.
	Integrated and tested predictive models on revised ML algorithms. Model documentation and code.
	UI component and backend logic for historical data collection, risk trends, verifications.
	Configured Cloud Messaging (or equivalent), notification service, and UI integration.
	Enhanced user notifications during sync (e.g., progress, success/failure messages, retry logic).
	Revised data collection, use, and privacy documentation based on approved standards from NDPR.
	Fully functional and tested Case Management component developed and delivered and exportable as a standalone module.
	Successful integration of&nbsp; the external APIs, enabling seamless, real-time information lookup within developed mobile applications.
	Operational Optical Character Recognition (OCR) and package recognition features that are capable of accurately scanning and identifying images and texts.
	Mobile applications compliant with modern accessibility standards, featuring functionalities such as screen reader support, dynamic text sizing, and high-contrast modes.
	Comprehensive and user-friendly User Manuals documenting all features and workflows of developed mobile systems.
	A secure, scalable, and efficiently designed database schema and implementation for the Case Management Module, ensuring data integrity and optimal performance.
	Implementation of offline-first mobile, using capture-and-sync later as well as USSD.
	Deployment and maintenance of fully integrated mobile solutions across Project supported states.


Required Qualifications


	Bachelor&rsquo;s or master&rsquo;s degree in computer science, Health Informatics, or a related field.
	5+ years of experience in digital health system development.
	Proven experience with:
	
		Mobile app development (Jetpack Compose, Kotlin, Flutter or React Native)
		Modular software architecture
		Push notification frameworks (e.g., FCM)
		Accessibility standards (WCAG)
		Familiarity with IRB processes and data ethics in health systems.
		Strong documentation and communication skills.
		Application programming Interface (API) integrations.

Grant & Compliance Officer Job at Care First Community Initiative (CFCI)




        
    

        
        Care First Community Initiative (CFCI) is a Nigerian NGO advancing human rights, social welfare, and livelihoods for vulnerable groups through Food Security, Research, Livelihoods, Education, Shelter/CCCM/NFI, Warehousing & Logistics, Nutrition, Health, Protection/Access to Justice, Advocacy/Information, and WASH.Care First Community Initiative (CFCI) is a Nigerian non-governmental organization (NGO). It focuses primarily on the education sector in the North-East region of Nigeria, particularly in Borno and Adamawa states.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Grant & Compliance Officer

Job Location: Maiduguri, Borno
Contract: 6 months (May be renewable)
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



Job Description


	We are recruiting for Grant & Compliance Officer to deliver integrated humanitarian programming in Maiduguri and Gwoza.
	Successful candidates will embody CFCI’s values of Impartiality, Neutrality, Independence, Accountability, Transparency, Integrity, Respect, and Inclusivity, and uphold strict Child Safeguarding standards.


Key Responsibilities 


	HR operations, communications & media, financial management/reporting, grant compliance, procurement, warehousing, and distribution logistics.
	Community mobilization, hygiene promotion, activity supervision, data collection/CFM, quality verification, environmental sanitation, and documentation.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s Degree (HR, PR / Communication, Accounting / Finance, Business / Admin)
	2–6 years of relevant experience; strong systems and compliance skills.
	Fluency in English and local languages; commitment to humanitarian principles, safeguarding and confidentiality; many roles prefer/require a valid driving licence.
	Safeguarding Levels: Vary by role (Level 1–3); all staff must comply with CFCI Child Safeguarding Policy.


Remuneration & Benefits


	Competitive salary commensurate with experience
	Professional development
	Statutory compliance
	Supportive, values-driven environment. Details provided in offer letters.


Interview Date: 20th November, 2025. 

Additional Information


	Equal Opportunity: CFCI welcomes all qualified applicants; no discrimination.
	No Fees: CFCI does not charge any application or recruitment fees.
	Background Checks: Shortlisted candidates will undergo rigorous screening (including police clearance and reference checks).
	Policies: All staff must comply with Child Safeguarding; Anti-Harassment & Discrimination; Whistle-blowing; Fraud Prevention; Health & Safety; Data Protection & Privacy; Code of Conduct; Equal Opportunities & Diversity.
